sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"坚持"之意。
means: insist ： 通常用于对意见、主张等的坚持。
persist ： 用于褒义指坚持继续做某事，但更常用于贬义，指不听劝告，顽固坚持。
persevere ： 含褒义，强调坚持不懈的努力。
adhere与to连用，指坚持意见、计划或承诺等，含坚持不懈之意。
cling和to连用，指对信仰、意见、习惯等的坚持。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"粘着，附着"之意。
means: stick ： 常指用胶水或浆糊粘贴，词义引申指坚持。
glue与stick的本义相同，指用胶水把东西粘合在一起，没有"坚持"的含义。
adhere ： 正式用词，语气较严肃刻板，既可指物体粘在一起，也可指坚持信仰或忠于事业等。
cling ： 着重靠缠绕、紧抱、紧抓等方式而形成密切关系。也可作引申用。
cohere ： 指物质微粒粘合在一起，成为不可分离的整体，强调所形成新物体的不可分割性。可引申指逻辑上的前后一致。

sentence.Network_en: The birds cling to the wall and nibble at the brickwork.
sentence.Network_cn: 鸟儿们紧贴在墙上，啄着砖缝。

sentence.Network_en: She had to cling onto the doorhandle until the pain passed.
sentence.Network_cn: 她不得不抓紧门把手，直到那阵疼痛过去。

sentence.Network_en: She had to cling onto the door handle until the pain passed.
sentence.Network_cn: 她只好紧紧握住门把手，直到不疼了才松开。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English clingan 'stick together', of Germanic origin; related to Middle Dutch klingen 'adhere', Middle High German klingen 'climb', also to clench

entry.def: If you cling to someone or something, you hold onto them tightly.

example.ex: Another man was rescued as he clung to the riverbank...
example.tran: 另外一个人因为紧紧攀住河堤而获救。

example.ex: She had to cling onto the door handle until the pain passed...
example.tran: 她只好紧紧握住门把手，直到不疼了才松开。

entry.def: If someone clings to a position or a possession they have, they do everything they can to keep it even though this may be very difficult.

example.ex: He appears determined to cling to power...
example.tran: 看来他决心要抓住权力不放。

example.ex: Another minister clung on with a majority of only 18...
example.tran: 另一位部长仅以18票的微弱优势保住了职位。

entry.def: Clothes that cling to you stay pressed against your body when you move.

example.ex: His sodden trousers were clinging to his shins.
example.tran: 湿淋淋的裤子紧紧粘在他小腿上。

entry.def: Something that is clinging to something else is stuck on it or just attached to it.

example.ex: Her glass had bits of orange clinging to the rim.
example.tran: 她的杯口上粘有些许橙汁。

entry.def: If someone clings to a person they are fond of, they do not allow that person to be free or independent.

example.ex: I was terrified he would leave me, so I was clinging to him.
example.tran: 我害怕他会离开我，所以缠着他不放。

entry.tran: 墨守，坚持(观念或行为方式)
entry.def: If you cling to an idea or way of behaving, you continue to believe in its value or importance, even though it may no longer be valid or useful.

example.ex: They know scholars reject their legend, but they still cling to their belief...
example.tran: 尽管知道学者们不相信他们的传说，他们还是坚持自己的信仰。

means.word_mean: 1. fruit (especially peach) whose flesh adheres strongly to the pit
1. come or be in close contact with; stick or hold together and resist separation;
2. to remain emotionally or intellectually attached;

sentences.sentence: "He clings to the idea that she might still love him."
"The child clung to his mother's apron"

Sentence.sentence: He tells the story of a patient, a first-time mother who complained that her young son was always clinging to her, wrapping himself around her legs wherever she went.

Since the 1980s, America has been increasingly clinging to the ideology of uncontrolled free markets and dismissing the role of government---following Ronald Regan's idea that "government is not the solution to our problem; government is the problem.

means.word_mean: 附着于 缠住 绕著

sentences.en: Dewdrops were still clinging on the trees.
He clung to the rope with both hands.
He clung to his own view.

jushi.english: Dewdrops were still clinging on the trees.
The smell of the onions clings.
